title: AnalyticKWS: Towards Exemplar-Free Analytic Class Incremental Learning for Small-footprint Keyword Spotting
author: Yang Xiao (The University of Melbourne), Tianyi Peng (Nanyang Technological University), Rohan Kumar Das (Fortemedia Singapore), Yuchen Hu (Nanyang Technological University), Huiping Zhuang (South China University of Technology), ...
relevance_why: The method’s contributions to keyword spotting directly overlap with Haohe Liu’s focus on audio processing and speech technologies, particularly in improving performance while safeguarding user privacy.
background: Incremental learning for keyword spotting aims to append new keywords in models while ensuring past knowledge remains intact, addressing the problem of catastrophic forgetting.
contribution: AnalyticKWS introduces an exemplar-free analytic learning method to mitigate catastrophic forgetting in keyword spotting systems, achieving higher accuracy with reduced memory usage and computational demand.
technical_comparison: Previous methods generally rely on storing past examples to maintain performance on earlier tasks, leading to privacy and memory concerns. This work improves by using a closed-form analytical update approach that eliminates the need to store past data while maintaining high accuracy.
key_innovation: The unique approach of using recursive least-squares methods for model updates without backpropagation sets this method apart, allowing it to efficiently learn new tasks without historical data.
real_world_impact: The proposed method enables efficient and privacy-preserving keyword recognition in real-time applications, especially useful for edge-computing devices with limited resources.

new_terms.exemplar-free: **Exemplar-free** refers to learning methods that do not require storing past data examples to maintain knowledge across tasks.
new_terms.analytic learning: **Analytic learning** is a method that focuses on deriving closed-form solutions to optimize model parameters instead of utilizing traditional gradient-based backpropagation.
